page.title: 05L.STAUGHTON AIRFIELD
page.content: Little Staughton has a{Second World {War Airfield}built for the R.A.F.Pathfinders.The R.A.F vacated it in 1957. From 1957 -1970 Brooklands Aviation rebuilt aeroplanes for the R.A.F. Later they let the buildings to various small companies. The first was Race Engine Services Ltd. Soon many other companies came to the airfield and it took on a second role as an industrial estate. The Airfield now has one runway. The second runway and perimeter tracks have been removed so that a larger area of ground can be used for arable farming.Approximately 30 companies occupy the{Industrial {Estate.}These companies include commercial vehicle bodybuilders,printers and bookbinders and an aeroplane restoration company.
